required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Describe the Immunogenicity and Safety of 2 Doses of Bivalent rLP2086 (Trumenba) and a Pentavalent Meningococcal Vaccine in Healthy Subjects >=10 to <26 Years of Age.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-controlled, Observer-blinded Study To Assess The Immunogenicity, Safety, And Tolerability Of Bivalent Rlp2086 When Administered As A 2-dose Regimen And A First-in-human Study To Describe The Immunogenicity, Safety, And Tolerability Of A Bivalent Rlp2086-Containing Pentavalent Vaccine (Menabcwy) In Healthy Subjects>=10 To <26 Years Of Age

brief_summary.textblock: This study is examining safety and immunogenicity of 2 doses of Trumenba administered on a 0-,6- month schedule. This trial is also studyng safety and immunogenicity of a meningococcal pentavalent vaccine.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With >=4 Fold Rise in Serum Bactericidal Assay Using Human Complement (hSBA) for 4 Primary MnB Strains and Composite Response (hSBA >=Lower Limit of Quantification [LLOQ] for All 4 Primary MnB Strains Combined) for Groups 2 + 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Vaccination 1 and 1 Month after Vaccination 2
primary_outcome.description: Assess B response after two doses of Trumenba

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Local Reactions (LRs) Within 7 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe local reactions after first dose of Trumenba

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Local Reactions (LRs) Within 7 Days After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe local reactions after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Systemic Events (SEs) and Antipyretic Use Within 7 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe systemic events and use of anti-pyretic medication after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Systemic Events (SEs) and Antipyretic Use Within 7 Days After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe systemic events and use of anti-pyretic medication after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) Within 30 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) Within 30 Days After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) Within 30 Days After Any Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 days after any vaccination in Stage 1
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency after any dose of Trumenba in Stage 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Stage 1 Vaccination Phase for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 1 month after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency during the Stage 1 vaccination phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Stage 1 Follow-up Phase for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 month after second vaccination up to 6 months after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency during the Stage 1 follow-up phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) Throughout Stage 1 of the Study for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 6 months after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe SAE frequency during the Stage 1 in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Medically Attended AE Within 30 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Medically Attended AE Within 30 Days After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Medically Attended AE Within 30 Days After Any Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency after any dose of Trumenba in Stage 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Medically Attended AE During the Stage 1 Vaccination Phase for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 1 month after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency during the Stage 1 vaccination phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Medically Attended AE During the Stage 1 Follow-up Phase for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 month after second vaccination up to 6 months after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency during the Stage 1 follow-up phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 6 months after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe MAE frequency during the Stage 1 in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Newly Diagnosed Chronic Medical Condition Within 30 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe NDCMC frequency after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 month after second vaccination up to 6 months after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe NDCMC frequency during the Stage 1 follow-up phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.description: Describe NDCMC frequency during the Stage 1 in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Adverse Event (AE) Within 30 Days After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe AE frequency after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 1 Adverse Event (AE) Within 30 Days After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe AE frequency after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 1 month after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe AE frequency during the Stage 1 vaccination phase in the Trumenba vaccination groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting at Least 1 Immediate Adverse Event (AE) After First Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe immediate AE frequency after first dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting at Least 1 Immediate Adverse Event (AE) After Second Vaccination for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.description: Describe immediate AE frequency after second dose of Trumenba.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Days Participants Missed School or Work Due to AE During the Stage 1 Vaccination Phase for Groups 2 and 4 combined
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first vaccination up to 1 month after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Describe the number of days missed from school or work due to an AE during the Stage 1 vaccination phase in Trumenba vaccination groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With hSBA Titers >=LLOQ for 4 Primary MenB Test Strains Before First Vaccination and 1 Month After the Second Bivalent rLP2086 Vaccination: Groups 2 and 4 combined
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before Vaccination 1 and 1 Month after Vaccination 2
secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With hSBA Titers >=1:4,>=1:8,>=1:16,>=1:32,>=1:64,>=1:128 for 4 Primary MenB Test Strains Before the First Vaccination and 1 Month After Second Bivalent rLP2086 Vaccination: Groups 2 and 4 combined

secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response (secondary strains) after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response (secondary strains) after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMTs for Each of the 10 Secondary MenB Strains Before First Vaccination and 1 Month After the Second Bivalent rLP2086 Vaccination: Groups 2 and 4 combined
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before Vaccination 1 and 1 Month after Vaccination 2
secondary_outcome.description: Describe B response (secondary strains) after two doses of Trumenba.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With hSBA Titers >=1:8 (or >=LLOQ if higher) for ACWY Test Strains 1 Month After the First Vaccination: Groups 1, 2, 3 and 4

secondary_outcome.description: Describe ACWY response after 1 dose of MenACWY-CRM compared to 1 dose of MenABCWY

intervention.description: N meningitidis group A, B, C, W, and Y vaccine
meningococcal group A, C, W-135, and Y conjugate vaccine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subject aged >=10 and <26 years at the time of enrollment.
- Healthy subject as determined by medical history, physical examination, and judgment of the investigator.
- Negative urine pregnancy test for all female subjects.
- Subjects who have not received, or who have received no more than 1 prior dose within the past 4 years, of a vaccine containing 1 or more ACWY serogroup
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccination with any meningococcal serogroup B or purely polysaccaride (nonconjugate) meningococcal vaccine.
- Subjects receiving any allergen immunotherapy with a nonlicensed product or receiving allergen immunotherapy with a licensed product and are not on stable maintenance doses.
- A known or suspected defect of the immune system that would prevent an immune response to the vaccine, such as subjects with congenital or acquired defects in B cell function, those receiving chronic systemic (oral, intravenous, or intramuscular) corticosteroid therapy, or those receiving immunosuppressive therapy. Subjects in the United States with terminal complement deficiency are excluded from participation in this study.
- Significant neurological disorder or history of seizure (excluding simple febrile seizure).
- Current chronic use of systemic antibiotics.
- Received any investigational vaccines, drugs, or devices within 28 days before administration of the first study vaccination.
- Any neuroinflammatory or autoimmune condition, including, but not limited to, transverse myelitis, uveitis, optic neuritis, and multiple sclerosis.
